345.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Frenchy's Popcorn, Inc.

346.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Landscape Lighting Concepts, Inc.
346.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Landscape Lighting Concepts, Inc.

347.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
347.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance-work On Holidays And Sundays
347.description: Repeals § 5-3-7 of the general laws which gives the director of the department of labor and training the authority to exempt certain classes of employees from receiving overtime pay for Sunday and holiday work.

348.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
348.title: Employment Of Women And Children
348.description: Requires children who seek a special limited work permit to successfully complete a worker rights' training program established and funded by the department of labor and training.

349.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
349.title: Minimum Wage--gratuities
349.description: Raises the minimum wage for tipped workers by fifty cents ($.50) per year commencing on January 1, 2019 until the tipped minimum wage is not less than two-thirds (2/3) of the regular minimum wage.

350.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
350.title: Tip Protection
350.description: Prohibits employers from receiving any portion of the tips given by customers to their tipped employees, with limited exceptions for credit card service charges.

351.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/15/2018)
351.title: Energize Rhode Island: Clean Energy Investment And Carbon Pricing Act Of 2018
351.description: Establishes a fee on companies that sell fossil fuels in Rhode Island and also establishes a receipt account to disburse the funds from.

353.title: Governor's Commission On Disabilities
353.description: Removes the requirement that a student with disabilities be a college student in order to be eligible to participate in the Mary Brennan fellowship fund program and also removes the requirement that the fellowship program take place in Providence.

354.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
354.title: Relating To Highways
354.description: Exempts veterans and active duty military from paying a toll on the Newport Bridge.

355.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
355.title: Fees
355.description: Raises the juror's fees for each day's attendance on the superior court to twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per day commencing July 1, 2019, and increase to thirty-five dollars ($35.00) per day commencing July 1, 2020 and thereafter.

357.title: Net Metering
357.description: Changes the definition of a net-metering financing arrangement and changes the crediting of net-metered accounts.

358.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
358.title: Relating To Education-funding Of Charter Public Schools
358.description: Requires charter schools to issue a detailed invoice to the public school districts for local aid.

359.title: Animal Care
359.description: Excludes veterinary hospitals, residences used to care for no more than 4 animals as kennels. Exempts residential settings from obtaining kennel license.

360.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
360.title: Continuity-of-care For Medically-fragile Students Act
360.description: Establishes standards of practice for providers of clinical nursing services for medically-fragile students.

361.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
361.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act
361.description: Exempts patients in the medical marijuana program from the data collection provisions of the "Uniform Controlled Substances Act".

362.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
362.title: Rhode Island Food, Drugs, And Cosmetics Act
362.description: Requires that all menstrual products sold in the state bear a label listing the name of each ingredient or component of the device in order of the most predominant ingredient to the least predominant ingredient.

363.title: Disposition Of Research Animals
363.description: Requires educational institutions using dogs or cats for medical research to make animals no longer useful for research available for adoption.

364.title: Pharmacies--partial Fills
364.description: Allows a pharmacist to dispense a partial fill of a Schedule II controlled substance at the request of the patient or the prescriber.

365.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
365.description: Provides group health plan or insurers cover clinically appropriate residential services, including detoxification for treatment of mental health or substance-abuse disorders and the patient remain presumptively covered during the assessment review.

366.last_action: House voted to recommit to House H.E.W.
366.title: Housing For The Elderly--emergency Generators Required
366.description: Requires emergency generators in any elderly housing complex consisting of more than five (5) residential units in one building sufficient to operate a refrigerator and at least one other electrical outlet in each unit.

370.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
370.title: The Net Neutrality Protection Act Of 2018
370.description: Requires net neutrality by fixed or mobile broadband Internet access services.

371.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
371.title: Shows And Exhibitions
371.description: Repeals the licensing requirements for certain shows or exhibitions occurring on Sundays with certain designated cities and/or towns.

373.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
373.title: Relating To The Smithfield Land Trust
373.description: Disbands the Smithfield Land Trust and transfers all function and real estate held by the Smithfield Land Trust to the town of Smithfield and Smithfield town council.

374.title: Subdivision Regulations
374.description: Permits the substitution by a developer of sprinklers in new developments instead of cisterns or water reservoirs for fire suppression, if allowed by ordinance.

375.last_action: House passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
375.title: Fair Employment Practices
375.description: Expands the protections and remedies for employees against employers who pay wage differentials based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability; age or country of ancestral origin.

376.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
376.title: Overtime Wages
376.description: Exempts certain executive, administrative, and professional employees from overtime pay if their weekly wages exceed one thousand thirty-six dollars ($1,036), an increase from the current two hundred dollars ($200).

377.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
377.title: Educational/ Child Care Involvement Leave
377.description: Grants parents/guardians/step-parents/foster parents/ custodial grandparents children attending kindergarten, grades 1-12, inclusive, or attending a licensed child care provider to utilize up to 40 hours from existing vacation period time per year.

378.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
378.title: Disability And Elderly Driving Expenses Tax Credit
378.description: Establishes 100% tax credit for disabled/elderly drivers age 65 and older for vehicle modification costs/training fees incurred necessary to retain their license/registration per rules/regs of tax administrator eff. 1/2018.

379.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
379.title: Joint Committee On Naming New Buildings
379.description: Names the traffic tribunal building on New London Avenue "The Albert E. DeRobbio Traffic Tribunal."

380.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
380.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes -- Liability And Computation
380.description: Establishes the deceased spousal unused credit against the Rhode Island estate tax available to a surviving spouse for the unused estate tax credit of the first spouse to decease.

382.last_action: Committee transferred to House Veterans Affairs
382.title: Disability Business Enterprises
382.description: Expands the existing disability business enterprises program.

384.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
384.title: The World Language And Dual Language Immersion Act
384.description: Establishes and require funding for a world language and dual language immersion program.

385.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/15/2018)
385.title: State Lottery
385.description: Authorizes the internet sale of lottery tickets with fifty percent of the proceeds to go to the state pension fund and fifty percent to go to the state lottery fund.

386.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
386.title: Administrative Procedures
386.description: Provides that the state board of elections would be subject to the rule-making provisions of the "administrative procedures act".

387.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
387.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriation
387.description: Repeals the statute imposing a fine not to exceed twenty dollars ($20.00) on a person robbing or drawing a fishpot, weir or net belonging to another person.

388.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
388.title: Highway
388.description: Repeals several criminal offenses pertaining to three (3) bridges, including the Crawford Street Bridge, the Apponaug River Bridge, and the Pawtuxet Falls Bridge.

389.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
389.title: Trespass And Vandalism
389.description: Repeals the prohibition of the general laws regarding the removal of gravel or the deposit of debris from Easton's Beach, the enforcement provisions, and the bounds of Easton's Beach.

390.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
390.title: Estates In Real Property--limitation Of Restrictive Covenants
390.description: Makes a technical amendment to the statute which provides for the automatic termination of certain real property restrictions after thirty (30) years has lapsed.

391.title: Contractors - Registration And Licensing Board
391.description: Distinguishes the criminal penalties for violating a final order of the Contractors' Registration Board. Judgments less than $5,000 are misdemeanors; judgments $5,000 or more are felonies.

392.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
392.title: Reporting Of Political Contributions By State Vendors
392.description: Amends the election laws concerning state or municipal vendors who are disqualified from making political contributions due to their business dealings with the state.

394.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
394.title: Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access To Digital Assets Act
394.description: Regulates fiduciary and designated recipient access to digital assets relating to probate practice and procedure by creating the "Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act" to promote uniformity of the law among states that enact it.

396.title: Elective Share
396.description: Clarifies the right of a surviving spouse of a decedent regarding elective shares taken against the decedent's will relating to real and personal estate to the estates of decedents dying on and after July 1, 2018.

397.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
397.title: Contractors' Registration And Licensing Board
397.description: Requires an applicant for any license or registration issued by the contractors’ registration and licensing board to undergo a national criminal records check, including fingerprints.

398.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Judiciary
398.title: Cell Phone Tracking
398.description: Provides that cell phone tracking notice and warrant requirements do not apply to location information obtained by court order intercepting wire/oral communications or pen registers/trap and trace devices.

399.title: Electronic Imaging Devices
399.description: Prohibits the dissemination of any indecent image of another person without authorization for the purpose of harassing, intimidating, threatening another person.

400.title: Unlawful Confinement Of A Covered Animal
400.description: Makes changes in the definitions of what constitutes unlawful confinement of any sow during gestation, calf raised for veal or egg-laying hen kept on a farm, and would apply them throughout the chapter accordingly.

401.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
401.title: Statutory Interest
401.description: Decreases from 12% per annum to 6% per annum the statutory interest rate added to judicial civil action money damage judgments.

405.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
405.title: False Report Of Crime
405.description: Creates an enhanced felony penalty for a person who falsely complains to police about a kidnapping or attempted murder, in progress.

406.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
406.title: Atlantic Time Zone
406.description: Provides for Rhode Island's adoption of the Atlantic Time Zone if and when Massachusetts does so.

407.title: Access To Public Records
407.description: Requires government officials to convert all data, electronic or otherwise, retained in compliance with the access to public records act, into a form readily and easily retrievable to enable them to comply with a records request.

408.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
408.title: Correctional Institutions
408.description: Repeals the provision declaring prisoners serving a life sentence civilly dead.

409.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
409.title: Solemnization Of Marriages
409.description: Requires returns of a marriage certificate to be filed within two (2) business days after the ceremony, and would validate the common practice of filing the return by mail.

410.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
410.title: Execution
410.description: Repeals the requirement that a body attachment be issued only upon a written ex parte motion made to a justice of the superior or district court, made by the party named in the action.

411.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
411.title: Burglary And Breaking And Entering
411.description: Repeals the section of the law which prohibits entering a building with intent to steal poultry.

412.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
412.title: Bigamy And Adultery
412.description: Repeals § 11-6-2 of the general laws wherein any individual who commits adultery shall be fined not exceeding five hundred dollars ($500).

413.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
413.title: Disorderly Conduct
413.description: Repeals the section of the law imposing a fine of up to five dollars ($5.00) for every person guilty of profane swearing and cursing.

414.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
414.title: False Personation
414.description: Removes auctioneers, corders of wood and fence viewers as subjects of this violation.

415.title: Arrest
415.description: Repeals section 12-7-9 ("conditions justifying force dangerous to life").

416.last_action: Referred to Senate Health and Human Services
416.title: Nurse Anesthetists
416.description: Permits a registered nurse who is enrolled in an accredited nurse anesthesia program to practice as a nurse anesthetist under the supervision of a certified registered nurse anesthetist or an anesthesiologist.

417.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
417.title: Appropriate Disability Language
417.description: Ensures appropriate disability language is used in job descriptions and statutes.

420.title: Real Estate Brokers And Salespersons
420.description: Increases the maximum administrative penalty levied against real estate brokers and salespersons from one thousand dollars ($1,000) to two thousand dollars ($2,000) per violation.

422.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
422.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities
422.description: Requires any public utility or its contractor to reimburse an excavator for lost time expense incurred, including manpower and equipment from the utilities incorrect marking of underground utilities.

423.title: Medical Assistance - Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
423.description: Establishes a public scorecard system to show how long-term care reform is meeting its goals of rebalancing the way services are delivered and moneys are spent on various service types.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: Registration Fees
424.description: Imposes a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for the registration of a camping recreational vehicle.

425.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
425.title: Benefits For Active Duty
425.description: Requires active duty military personnel receive daycare services for their dependents at state expense.

426.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/29/2018)
426.title: Central Falls Retiree Pension Benefits
426.description: Provides gradual pension benefits increase over 5-year period starting 9/1/18 from 75% to 87.5% of base amount using cost-of-living adjustments over lifetime.

427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
427.title: Rhode Island Commerce Corporation
427.description: Requires the Rhode Island commerce corporation to submit quarterly financial reports.

428.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
428.title: Personal Income Tax - Part 44-30-81 Procedure And Administration
428.description: Provides, for the tax year 2017 and thereafter, that any tax overpayment would be refunded with interest calculated at twelve percent (12%) compounded daily if not received by the thirtieth day of June in the subsequent year.

429.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
429.title: Commerce Corporation
429.description: Prohibits the state commerce corporation, without express general assembly approval, providing any grants or loans of any kind that exceed five million dollars ($5,000,000).

432.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

432.description: Authorizes EOHHS to seek Medicaid section 1115 waivers or state-plan amendments to enhance support for unpaid family caregivers and requires EOHHS to submit annual reports to the house and senate finance committees and to post reports on EOHHS website.

434.title: Withholding Of Tax
434.description: Provides that non-resident withholding requirement for a corporation that sells real estate be consistent with the seven percent (7%) corporate income tax rate.

435.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act -- Non-opiate Directive
435.description: Establishes a procedure for individuals to file a revocable voluntary non-opiate directive form with the person's licensed health care practitioner.

437.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
437.title: Personal Care Assistant Program
437.description: Requires the registration, certification, and regulation of those individuals who provide personal care assistant services to a consumer.

439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
439.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act
439.description: Requires a landlord to maintain a general liability insurance policy of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) and to introduce the policy in any trespass and ejection action.

441.title: Notaries Public And Justices Of The Peace
441.description: Repeals the current state provisions regarding notaries and adopts an adapted version of the "Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts."

442.title: Proceedings In Family Court
442.description: Defines "adult" as 18 years and older. Eliminates limitation on family court jurisdiction for cases of 17 year old children charged with specific serious crimes.

444.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
444.title: Crimes Against The Public Trust
444.description: Creates a new chapter and make several amendments to existing statutes providing for penalties for crimes against the public trust.

445.title: Adjudication Of Traffic Offenses
445.description: Provides that the traffic tribunal would have exclusive jurisdiction for second and subsequent violations of blood test refusals related to a suspected DUI.

447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
447.title: Relating To Elections
447.description: Eliminates the election offense for posting political circulars that criticize a candidate.

448.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
448.title: Political Parties
448.description: Allows a political organization to become a political party by collecting voter signatures earlier than the current January 1 of the election year start date.

450.title: Relating To Property
450.description: Eliminates the penalty of abating rent in cases where a non-resident landlord fails to designate an agent for service of process and would clarify that the fine for violating this section is civil.

451.title: Procedures Generally - Causes Of Action
451.description: Allows a minor to bring specified malpractice actions at any time up to reaching twenty-one (21) years of age.

452.title: Property Subject To Taxation
452.description: Allows Tiverton to prorate tax due and payable upon sale of tax exempt property to purchaser holding no tax exempt status for that calendar year.

453.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
453.title: Public Drinking Water Supply System Protection
453.description: Provides that persons ages sixty-five (65) years and over who have a surcharge applied to water supplied to them for personal use and consumption would receive a twenty-five (25%) discount on such surcharge.

454.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Exemption For Indigent And Infirm Persons In The Town Of West Greenwich
454.description: Permits the town of West Greenwich to create five (5) year tax liens on real estate owned by infirm and indigent persons in lieu of paying regular taxes where those persons have been determined as unable to pay by the assessor.

456.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
456.title: Tourism And Development
456.description: Reduces the rental period from thirty (30) days to six (6) days in regard to the exclusion from the definition of occupancy for any home, condominium or other residential dwelling rented.

457.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
457.title: General Powers
457.description: Requires certain costs of police training to be reimbursed when an officer leaves one community department for another.

458.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tremont Associates Ii, Inc.
458.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tremont Associates Ii, Inc.

459.title: Courts
459.description: Establishes a new and separate calendar within the superior court to expediently hear and decide land use matters concerning the development of renewable energy resources.

460.title: Voter Registration
460.description: Requires the secretary of state to notify the appropriate elected official of a newly registered voter's most recent former place of residence, only if it is located outside of Rhode Island.

461.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
461.title: Litter Control And Recycling
461.description: Expands the definition of litter to include commercial signs placed on public property or telephone poles, and allows the authorities to remove such signs without risk of criminal penalties or civil suits.

462.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
462.title: Public Use Of Private Lands--liability Limitations
462.description: Changes the definition of "owner" to exclude the state and municipalities for the purposes of liability limitations relating to public use of private lands.

464.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
464.title: Eligibility To Vote
464.description: Allows individuals, who have not reached the age of eighteen (18) years, to vote in a primary election, as long as the voter will be eighteen (18) as of the date of the general or special election.

466.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
466.title: Fair Housing Practices
466.description: Prohibits discrimination in housing against those persons who have a lawful source of income.

467.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
467.title: Residence Of Those In Government Custody Act
467.description: Establishes a process to ensure persons in government custody are counted as their actual residence for purposes of redistricting.

468.title: Procedure Generally -- Jury Lists
468.description: Adds individuals receiving public assistance to the list of persons liable and qualified for jury service and mandates the director of human services to provide the jury commissioner with a list of those people on public assistance on a yearly basis.

469.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
469.title: Judicial Nominating Commission
469.description: Requires that the judicial selection commission be composed of at least three (3) members of color.

470.title: Full Enforcement Of Support Obligations
470.description: Subjects obligors of child support to license suspension after a 60-day arrearage but provides conditional driving privileges for employment.

471.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
471.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses
471.description: Revises the definition of a felony, misdemeanor and petty misdemeanor, and requires a correctional impact statement for all legislation affecting corrections.

472.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
472.title: Procedure Generally
472.description: Provides that an open and obvious danger or defect is not a complete bar to recovery of damages in personal injury or property damage actions.

474.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
474.title: Rhode Island Values Act--enhanced Community Protection In Immigration Enforcement Action
474.description: Enhances community protection during ICE enforcement and investigatory actions.

477.title: Procedure Generally - The State False Claim Act
477.description: Amends the State False Claims Act to reflect amendments to the Federal False Claims Act.

479.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
479.title: Trust
479.description: Permits settlor of trust to provide for person other than trustees to direct trustee's actions/clearly establishes legal responsibilities of trust advisors/protectors.

480.title: Party Conventions
480.description: Removes the requirement that each political party convene every two (2) years to adopt a platform.

481.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
481.title: Temporary Disability Insurance
481.description: Amends the computation formula relative to temporary disability insurance and adds siblings and caregivers to those workers eligible to receive temporary caregiver insurance.

484.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
484.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
484.description: Provided that the transition plan for education aid begun in fiscal year 2012 would be frozen in place at the rates and calculations in effect for the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2017.

485.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
485.title: Public Utilities Commission
485.description: Reassesses any utility rate increase after January 1, 2017, and evaluate whether the increase in rate results in excessive profits to the utility company.

487.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
487.title: Rhode Island Ocean State Fund
487.description: Allows for a credit equal to the amount contributed by a taxpayer for the taxable year to the Rhode Island Ocean State Fund, which is created in the general fund to accept monetary contributions for exclusively public purposes.

489.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
489.title: Micro Zone Economic Revitalization Act
489.description: Creates micro zones in distressed areas to stimulate economic revitalization/employment opportunities/business development through redevelopment of abandoned industrial/commercial structures.

491.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
491.title: Relating To Human Services-public Assistance
491.description: Provides that for the purpose of determining income limitations for receiving general public assistance, child support that is in arrears for thirty (30) days or more would not be considered to be income.

492.title: Relating To Towns And Cities
492.description: Amends provisions of the tax increment financing act in order to encourage municipalities to use tax increment financing to facilitate economic development. Effective 7/1/2018.

493.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
493.title: Small Loan Lenders
493.description: Repeals provisions of the general laws allowing deferred deposit providers, also known as "payday lenders."

496.title: Retail Sale Of Gasoline
496.description: Eliminates the requirement that a waiver for fuel content standards be obtained from both weights and measures (DLT) and the department of environmental management (DEM).

498.title: The Rhode Island Limited Liability Company Act
498.description: Provides that the alternate window for documents filed with the secretary of state to take effect is increased from up to thirty (30) days to up to ninety (90) days.

499.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Corporations
499.title: Insurance Consumer Protection Sales Act
499.description: Creates a system of consumer protection for regulation by DBR of noninsurance business entities using or disclosing personal identifiable financial information for insurance sales.

500.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
500.title: Condominium Law--resale Of Units
500.description: Imposes a penalty on a condominium association for failing to deliver a resale certificate within ten (10) days of a request by a unit owner, and establishes a maximum fee of $125 for compiling a resale certificate.

501.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
501.description: Exempts natural hair braiders from the requirement to be licensed as hairdressers or cosmeticians, and defines the practice of natural hair braiding.

503.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
503.title: Americanization Of Schools
503.description: Repeals requirement that persons between 16 and 21 who cannot speak, read or write English to attend classes until they learn (minimum 200 hours). Also repeals fines and institutional commitment for failure to take such classes.

506.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
506.title: Board Of Medical
506.description: Establishes a process to license physicians by reciprocity to practice medicine in this state.

507.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
507.title: Patient Access Expansion Act
507.description: Prohibits the state from requiring any form of the Federation of State Medical Boards' proprietary maintenance of licensure program.

509.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
509.title: Provision Of Volunteer Health Care Services
509.description: Grants immunity from liability and suit to health care professionals, workers, and facilities providing volunteer services, and would also provide continuing education credits for such services.

510.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
510.title: Long-term Care Insurance
510.description: Requires long-term health plan issuers to provide a 90 day written notice of premium increase and alternative to maintain coverage at same cost. Limits increase to 10% for plans sold on or after January 1, 2019.

511.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
511.title: Department Of Health
511.description: Allows parents or guardians of a child to opt out of vaccines for non-casual contact diseases transmitted by sexual contact.

512.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
512.title: State Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act -- Duties Of Commissioner]
512.description: Directs the commissioner of elementary and secondary education to issue regulations restricting cell phone use by students in the public schools during the school day unless they are being used in connection with an assignment or curriculum.

514.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
514.title: Procedure Generally -- Litigation Lending Agreements
514.description: Makes litigation loan agreements subject to state usury laws.

515.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
515.title: Confidentiality Of Health Care Communications And Information
515.description: Prohibits disclosure in a civil action of a person's confidential health care information through ex parte contact with the provider or the provider's legal representative.

516.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
516.title: Divorce And Separation
516.description: Creates a custody procedure for pets in divorce and separation proceedings based on the best interests of the animal.

517.title: Election Offenses
517.description: Deletes the requirement that a political circular or flier contain the name of its author.

521.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
521.title: Return Of Seized Property
521.description: Requires state and municipal authorities to return forfeited property 90 days after the underlying substantive matter is concluded in the owner's favor unless the property seized is a forfeitable controlled substance.

522.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
522.title: Weapons - Safe Schools Act
522.description: Provides that only peace officers and persons approved by the school authorities for the purposes of educational instruction may carry firearms or other weapons on school grounds.

524.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
524.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses - Violations
524.description: Allows a person to make satisfactory arrangements for the payment of motor vehicle fines or costs, and would permit a person to request an ability to pay hearing before a license is suspended for failure to pay such fines or costs.

525.title: Trial
525.description: Establishes compliance/certification procedure for criminal pre-trial discovery/creates a 9 member task force to investigate/make recommendations, pre-trial discovery with report due 1/1/20 and dissolution on 1/1/22.

526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
526.title: Correctional Institutions - Parole
526.description: Provides that prisoners who committed offenses prior to age eighteen (18) and were sentenced as adults would be eligible for parole after completing fifteen (15) years of their sentence.

529.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
529.title: Bail And Recognizance
529.description: Amends the conditions of bail and recognizance to permit the release of a person charged with a misdemeanor without financial conditions.

534.title: Consumer Empowerment And Identity Prevention Act Of 2006
534.description: Provides that a consumer report agency may not charge a consumer a fee for any security freeze service. Effective September 1, 2018.

535.title: Certificates Of Title And Security Interests
535.description: Permits the division of motor vehicles to issue a certificate of title to certain types of trailers, including a travel trailer, a fifth wheel trailer, and a park trailer.

536.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
536.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
536.description: Requires federal national criminal records check for applicants for a hackney's operator license or a transportation network operator or driver.

537.title: Uninsured Motorist Identification Database Procedure
537.description: Mandates each motor vehicle policy insurer provide a weekly record of each policy to the department of motor vehicles. A vehicle owner not insured for four (4) reporting periods must be notified to meet certain requirements.

538.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
538.title: The Consumer Protection In Eye Care Act
538.description: Provides for consumer protection in eye care services by developing standards and enforcement protocols related to the utilization of emergent technologies in the provision of eye care services and for the delegation of eye care services by providers.

540.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
540.title: Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact
540.description: Authorizes the governor to enter into the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact and would designate an office to administer this compact.

542.last_action: House passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
542.title: Equal Rights Of Blind And Deaf Persons To Public Facilities
542.description: Prohibits misrepresentation of an animal as a service animal. RI Commission for human rights to provide decals/signs and information to businesses. Penalty of $500 and/or 30 hours community service for violation.

543.title: Homeless Bill Of Rights
543.description: Protects homeless persons in possession of a service animal, as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act, from being denied access to any homeless shelter in violation of the ADA or the state or federal Fair Housing Practices Acts.

546.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
546.title: Child Care--state Subsidies
546.description: Raises the maximum reimbursement rate for licensed child care providers by five percent (5%).

548.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
548.title: Public Service Corporation Tax
548.description: Clarifies the accumulated depreciation reduction by taking into account physical deterioration and obsolescence.

549.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
549.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes - Liability And Computation
549.description: Allows a credit against the Rhode Island estate tax of ninety-nine thousand six hundred dollars ($99,600) for decedents who have died after December 31, 2018.

551.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Use
551.description: Clarifies the term drug addiction as a chronic/relapsing brain disease with compulsive drug seeking/use despite harmful consequences.

555.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
555.title: Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction And Maintenance Fund--tolls
555.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws which created the "Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction, and Maintenance Fund Act of 2016" ("Rhode Works"), which would have imposed tolls on large commercial trucks.

559.title: Relating To Public Officers And Employees
559.description: Moves state employee public safety professionals from the state retirement system to the municipal retirement system, effective July 1, 2018. It sets their retirement contribution to 10% of their compensation.

560.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
560.title: Post-retirement Employment
560.description: Increases the amount from eighteen thousand dollars ($18,000) to twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000) that retired state educators could earn in yearly compensation in their post-retirement, before their retirement benefits would be reduced.

561.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
561.title: Firefighters' Arbitration
561.description: Continues all provisions of firefighter's collective bargaining agreements until a successor agreement has been reached or an interest arbitration award has been rendered.

562.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
562.title: Municipal Police Arbitration
562.description: Extends provisions of an existing collective bargaining agreement for municipal police arbitration purposes until a successor agreement is reached or an interest arbitration award is rendered.

563.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
563.title: Seasonal Employment
563.description: Creates a seasonal employment designation for purposes of unemployment insurance which would allow employers hiring employees 20 weeks training/prevent seasonal employers from collecting unemployment benefits during the term of their seasonal employment.

564.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
564.title: Wages
564.description: Gradually increases the hourly minimum wage from $9.60 to $15.00 on January 1, 2022, as well as gradually increasing the hourly minimum wage for employees receiving gratuities from $3.89 an hour to $15.00 an hour on January 1, 2026.

566.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
566.title: Garbage Feeding
566.description: Repeals the entirety of section imposing a fine on carrying swill (garbage) into the town of Middletown to feed swine.

568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
568.title: Asset Forfeiture
568.description: Standardizes procedures for asset forfeitures for all crimes simplifying procedures and addresses counterproductive incentives.

569.title: Dogs
569.description: Prohibits the sale of dogs under 8 weeks of age unless approval for sale in writing from a licensed Rhode Island veterinarian with violations subject to imprisonment not to exceed 12 months or $1,000, or both. Pounds and shelters are exempt.

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
570.title: Pickled Fish
570.description: Repeals sections of the general laws dealing with grading of various qualities of mackerel and the sale or export of pickled fish not approved or branded

574.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
574.title: Hotels
574.description: Authorizes an innkeeper to remove any guest who is a level III high risk sexual offender who attempts to remain a hotel resident for more than thirty (30) consecutive days in any calendar year.

576.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
576.title: Judicial Selection
576.description: Requires that when a judge of color on a state or municipal court leaves the bench, they would be replaced by a person of color.

577.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
577.title: Courts - Judicial Nominating Commission
577.description: Requires that the judicial selection commission actively and aggressively solicit members of color to apply for judicial appointments, including practicing members of the Rhode Island Bar residing in border states.

579.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
579.title: Publication Of Municipal And Other Public Budgets In Digital Form
579.description: Makes public entity budgets available in digital form through the secretary of state.

581.title: Maternal And Child Health Services For Children With Special Health Care Needs
581.description: Requires the health director to apply for federal funds or grants relating to maternal mental health, prenatal care, postpartum care, neonatal and infant care with a report to the general assembly with a spending plan on or before 1/1/2020.

583.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
583.title: Rhode Island Resource Recovery Corporation
583.description: Limits municipal tipping fees paid by municipalities to rate increases of no more than four percent (4%) per year over the base rate of forty-seven dollars ($47.00) a ton beginning in July of 2019 for fiscal year 2020-2021, and all years thereafter.

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
585.title: Personal Income Tax - Tax Credit Where Ripta Service Not Provided
585.description: Gives any resident of a city or town lacking RIPTA bus service a credit on such resident's Rhode Island income tax of $.03 per gallon of gas purchased in this state.

586.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
586.title: Sales And Use Tax
586.description: Exempts from the state sales tax the trade-in value of pickup trucks under six thousand pounds (6,000 lbs.) gross weight, used exclusively for personal use.

587.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
587.title: Cigarette Tax-minimum Price Of Cigarettes
587.description: Requires that a fifteen percent (15%) minimum markup be added to the total cost of cigarettes sold by retailers in addition to any other taxes imposed by the state.

588.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
588.title: Long-term Leasing Contracts For Renewable Energy
588.description: Clarifies that interconnection and standby transformer costs incurred by any electric distribution co. For BI be charged in transmission rates and socialized across RI and provides for the reimbursement of BI Power Co. By National Grid for such costs.

590.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
590.title: Low And Moderate Income Housing
590.description: Allows a local review board of a city or town to provide reasonable conditions and limitations on any low and moderate income housing project.

591.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
591.title: Rebuild Rhode Island Tax Credit
591.description: Provides that a baseball stadium or athletic facility would not qualify as a qualified small business project under the rebuild Rhode Island tax credit program.

593.title: Residential Renewable Energy System Tax Credit
593.description: Allows carry over of residential renewable energy tax credits for a maximum of three years.

594.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
594.title: Education Assistance And Development Tax Credit
594.description: Creates a tax-credit for the amount in excess of ten thousand dollars ($10,000) contributed to a public school district for the express purpose of making physical improvement to a school.

598.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
598.title: Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
598.description: Provides 6% base rate increase for Medicaid home care for skilled nursing/therapeutic/nurse assistants/homemakers; 40% increase for Medicaid home care/hospice providers with annual inflation increase effective July 1, 2019.

599.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
599.title: Check Cashing
599.description: Raises the maximum check cashing fee from fifty cents ($.50) to six dollars ($6.00) per check, for persons cashing checks incidental to the retail sale of goods or services.

601.title: T.f. Green Airport
601.description: Renames the state airport in Warwick to "Rhode Island International Airport" and would rename the building known as the "Interlink" to the "Theodore Francis Green Interlink."

602.title: The Rhode Island Public Power Utility Council Act
602.description: Establishes the Rhode Island public power utility council.

603.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
603.title: Department Of Business Regulation--automobile Wrecking And Salvage Yards
603.description: Prohibits any entity or individual from advertising the sale, purchase, receipt, transport, delivery or salvage of any auto wrecking or discarded automobile unless the advertiser is a licensed junk or salvage yard.

604.title: Insurance Rates
604.description: Prevents credit history or score from being used to determine insurance rates.

605.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
605.title: Distributed Generation Interconnection
605.description: Creates stringent requirements on electric distribution companies to respond to an application for a renewable distributed generation interconnection.

608.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
608.title: Animals At Large
608.description: Repeals the section of the law authorizing the impoundment of at large animals in private ways in Newport.

609.title: Ordinances
609.description: Allows cities and towns to issue violations to vehicles which are used for illegal dumping of materials, pursuant to city and town ordinances.

612.title: School Social Workers
612.description: Creates a process for the department of education relating to the collection and organization of information concerning the workload and scope of the duties and responsibilities performed by school social workers.

613.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
613.title: Offenses Pertaining To Schools
613.description: Provides an exception to required school immunizations for pupils whose personal, philosophical, or religious beliefs are contrary to immunization and/or testing.

614.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
614.title: Biodiesel Heating Oil Act Of 2013
614.description: Adds a definition for "fuel oil terminal" for the purposes of the Biodiesel heating oil act of 2013.

615.title: Extreme Risk Protection Orders -- Criminal Offenses -- Weapons
615.description: Authorizes the supreme court to issue "extreme risk protections orders" requiring the surrender of all firearms from persons determined to be capable of causing personal injury.

617.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
617.title: Maternal Mental Health
617.description: Establishes a comprehensive plan to diagnose, treat and support mothers who suffer from maternal mental health disorders.

618.title: Office Of Medical Examiners
618.description: Provides that the state medical examiner is to conduct a multi-disciplinary team review of drug-related overdose deaths.

620.last_action: House passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
620.title: School Waste Recycling And Refuse Disposal
620.description: Requires schools to comply with recycling and composting laws and promotes food donation and local food service contracts.

621.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
621.title: Pharmacies - Insurance - Prescription Drug Benefits
621.description: Establishes rights pursuant to pharmacist-patient relationship.

622.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure
622.description: Creates an action at law authorizing any person who has been sentenced to a term of imprisonment greater than 1 year subsequent to being wrongfully convicted of a criminal offense to petition for an award of compensation, damages and attorneys' fees.

624.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
624.title: School And Youth Programs Concussion Act
624.description: Requires all school districts to designate an athletic trainer to be available for high school athletic practices and games.

627.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
627.title: Prescription Drug Sales - Representative Disclosure Act
627.description: Requires prescription drug manufacturers to file a detailed, updated list of each pharmaceutical sales representative and to pay an annual fee for each name listed with the department of business regulation.

629.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
629.title: Physical Therapists
629.description: Includes in the practice of physical therapy ordering diagnostic images and studies provided they are performed and interpreted by other licensed health care professionals.

631.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
631.title: Protecting Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
631.description: Establishes privacy rights with respect to take-home technology devices from school and establishes monitoring and access criteria thereto.

633.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
633.title: Relating To Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities And Hospitals
633.description: Expands certain rights of persons with developmental disabilities.

636.title: Homicide
636.description: Creates a new criminal offense for the delivery of a controlled substance resulting in death.

637.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
637.title: Special Police For Private Institutions
637.description: Clarifies the jurisdiction of special police officers upon the land and buildings of educational institutions, and on roads adjacent to the educational institutions to instances where the officer notices that a person is in danger of bodily harm.

642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
642.title: Nomination Deadlines
642.description: Makes changes in the declaration of candidacy period from late June to early June and moves primary elections from September to August.

643.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
643.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses, And Misappropriation
643.description: Amends certain campaign contribution and expenditure reporting requirements and provides for forfeiture of campaign contributions upon a candidate's conviction of certain felonies.

644.title: The Uniform Controlled Substances Act
644.description: Exempts certain prepackaged manufacturer-supplied steroids and hormones from the pharmaceutical dosage limits contained in the uniform controlled substance act.

645.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
645.title: Substance Abuse--involuntary Commitment Of Substance Abusers
645.description: Provides for the involuntary commitment of drug and intoxicating substance abusers who are a danger to themselves or others.

646.last_action: House passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
646.title: Emergency Commitment For Drug Intoxication
646.description: Authorizes a seventy-two (72) hour hold to be ordered by a physician in certain instances of substance abuse disorders.

647.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
647.title: Divorce And Separation -- Child Support
647.description: Extends child support for children attending college and living with custodial parent; restricts the court's power to modify existing orders of child support regarding arrearages owed to custodial parent even if the parties agree to waive.

649.title: Mail Ballots
649.description: Amends the time within which mail ballots must be returned to the state board of elections and the time to commence the counting of mail ballots on election day, from nine o'clock (9:00) p.m. to eight o'clock (8:00) p.m.

651.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
651.title: Campaign Finance
651.description: Makes several changes to the campaign finance report requirements to promote their regularity and accuracy.

652.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
652.title: Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting
652.description: Increases the yearly aggregate amount that may be contributed to or accepted by a person, political action committee or political party committee to two thousand dollars ($2,000).

653.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
653.title: Pfas In Food Packaging
653.description: Prohibits PFAS, a class of fluorinated organic chemicals, from being used in food packaging.

654.title: Courts - Language Interpreters - Use Of Language Interpreters In Legal Proceedings
654.description: Protects communications between language interpreters appointed under this chapter and limited-English-proficient persons.

655.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
655.title: Electronic Vehicle Recovery Services
655.description: Creates the "Electric Vehicle Recovery Services Act" to require vehicle owners with electronic recovery systems to submit an affidavit attesting to the theft of their motor vehicle prior to law enforcement contacting the recovery service provider.

658.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Judiciary
658.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses
658.description: Permits adults with valid foreign driver's licenses to drive in Rhode Island in compliance with Geneva Convention.

659.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
659.title: Games Of Chance
659.description: Decriminalizes violations regarding games of chance and would make violations punishable by a civil fine of up to one thousand dollars ($1000).

660.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
660.title: Condominium Law
660.description: Changes newspaper notice publication requirements and grants defaulting unit owner rights of post-sale notice and rights of redemption.

664.title: Vacancy In General Assembly
664.description: Enables a chief executive of a town or city to appoint a representative or senator to a vacant seat in the general assembly until a special election is held.

665.title: Flags And Emblems
665.description: Imposes a fine of five hundred dollars for desecrating the American flag.

668.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
668.title: Inheritance From Child By Non-supporting Parent
668.description: Provides a mechanism for disqualification of parent(s) of a child who dies intestate upon petition to the probate court for denial or limitation of the right of the parent(s) to a share of the decedent's estate.

670.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
670.title: Pen Registers And Trap And Trace Devices
670.description: Prohibits the use of a stingray cell-site simulator device by any law enforcement agency except upon application for its use and the granting of its order by the presiding justice of the superior court.

671.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
671.title: Search Warrants
671.description: Provides for issuance of search warrants on probable cause for electronic communication service providers with customers in Rhode Island.

675.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
675.title: Automated Traffic Violation Monitoring Systems
675.description: Repeals the Rhode Island automated traffic violation monitoring system act of 2005/the Rhode Island automated school-zone-speed-enforcement system act of 2016 authorizing the use of sensors which produce images of motor vehicles violating traffic laws.

678.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
678.title: Extreme Risk Protection Orders -- Criminal Offenses--weapons
678.description: Establishes a procedure where a person who is determined to be an extreme risk to themselves or others will be required to surrender their firearm for a certain period.

679.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
679.title: Public Accountancy
679.description: Deletes the phrase “crime of moral turpitude” as a cause for denying or revoking a license of various businesses and professions.

680.title: Vital Records
680.description: Requires that a death certificate reflect the decedent’s gender identity, as reported by the next of kin.

683.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
683.title: Subdivision Of Land
683.description: Allows residential only projects to remain minor and subject to the lesser time period for certification. Adds more time for cert. And resubmission at the master and preliminary plan phases on major projects but reducing such time for the final plan.

684.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
684.title: Mobile And Manufactured Homes--affordable Housing
684.description: Qualifies mobile and manufactured homes as affordable housing when installed and affixed in mobile and manufactured home parks in groups of twenty (20) or more for a year or more.

685.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
685.title: Firewood And Charcoal
685.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws that require baskets of charcoal be sealed by the sealer of weights and measures of the town where the person so using the basket resides, or of the town where the charcoal is measured for sale.

686.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
686.title: Soda And Cream Of Tartar
686.description: Repeals the requirement that city and town councils appoint an inspector or saleratus, bicarbonate of soda, and cream of tartar in order to test for adulterated product, and eliminates the fine for any person selling such adulterated product.

687.title: State Building Code - Administration And Enforcement
687.description: Requires that all electrical work performed in the state be done in accordance with the latest edition of the National Electric Code, and would also require that the state building commission adopt the latest edition of the National Electric Code.

690.title: Definitions And General Code Provisions
690.description: Amends several provisions relative to truck size and weight limitations to be compatible with federal law.

691.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
691.title: Wine Direct Shipper License
691.description: Creates a wine direct shipper license and a wine gift basket license allowing for the shipment of certain amounts of wine both in and out-of-state.

692.title: Registration To Motor And Other Vehicles -- Registration Of Vehicles
692.description: Exempts vehicle owners by a rental company from provisions permitted to the DMV to refuse registration for failure to pay fines including interest, penalties, or other monetary amount.

693.title: Licensing
693.description: Removes the requirement that hunting and fishing licenses may be issued only by town and city clerks.

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Home Heating Oil Sales
694.description: Provides that a home heating oil dealer subject to delivery contract shall provide oil within 24 hours or waive penalty.

696.title: Rhode Island Seed Act
696.description: Provides that jurisdiction of all use of agricultural and vegetable seeds is vested exclusively in the director of the department of environmental management.

697.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
697.title: New Home Buyers Fire Protection Act
697.description: Mandates builders of new 1 and 2 family dwellings to provide written info to buyer about installation of automatic sprinkler system subject to civil penalties for violations/results of radon tests/certification of working smoke detector devices eff 1/1/19

699.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
699.title: Reciprocity Agreements
699.description: Specifically authorizes the governor and the reciprocity board to enter into motor vehicle and disability parking reciprocity agreements with the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico.

700.title: Changeable Message Signs
700.description: Regulates the use of electronic changeable highway message signs (CMS) and requires the signs to display traffic operational, regulatory, warning, guidance, accident, and road information only.

701.title: Refuse Disposal
701.description: Includes a facility's potential detrimental impact on the community as a factor to be considered when approving the construction or operation of a solid waste management facility.

702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
702.title: Department Of Administration
702.description: Requires verification of computer hours worked by contractors for professional technical services rendered to depts of transportation, health, human services, administration and commerce in excess of $100,000 for bids/proposals issued on/after 7/1/18.

703.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
703.title: Insurance Data Security Act
703.description: Creates the "Insurance Data Security Act" which would adopt the National Association of Insurance Commissioners Model Act regarding data security.

704.title: Hawkers And Peddlers
704.description: Provides for the consolidation of food truck registration within the department of business regulation to streamline the registration process and reduce the burden on small businesses.

705.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
705.title: Veterans' Property Exemptions
705.description: Authorizes town of Coventry to enact ordinance granting $1,000 exemption to person who was member of National Guard for not less than 5 consecutive years or served in National Guard and called to active duty by President.

706.title: The Rhode Island Energy Resources Act
706.description: Requires, by July 1, 2019, the establishment of renewable energy siting ordinances in all cities and towns which would meet the standards set by a working group within the office of energy resources.

707.title: Shellfish Grounds
707.description: Ensures compliance with the National Shellfish Sanitation Program.

708.title: Relating To Military Affairs And Defense
708.description: Requires office of Veteran Affairs to bear the cost of all tolls incurred by any motor vehicles that are part of a veteran's funeral procession, originating from Aquidneck Island and ending at the Veterans' Memorial Cemetery, for burial or internment.

709.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
709.title: Selection Of Arbitrators
709.description: Replaces the American Arbitration Association, as the selector of labor arbitrators, in non-grievance contract matters, with the director of the department of labor and training.

710.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
710.title: Noncompete Agreements - Broadcast Employees
710.description: Prohibits the inclusion of noncompete agreements in broadcast industry employment contracts that are entered into after January 1, 2019.

715.title: Quality Self-directed Services -- Public Officers And Employees -- Individual Providers Of Direct Support Services
715.description: Enables the creation of a public registry of home health aides, giving seniors and individuals living with disabilities another choice when accessing long-term care options.

717.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
717.title: Education Equity And Property Tax Relief
717.description: Provides for quarterly assessments of district payments to charters, Davies and the Met Center calculated on a per diem basis and payable within 30 days and requires those schools to keep enrollment records with student ID numbers to avoid double billing.

720.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
720.title: Least Cost Procurement
720.description: Caps the system benefit charge at the annual published Consumer Price Index or two and one-half percent (2.5%), whichever is greater.

723.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
723.title: Rhode Island Best Rx Prescription Drug Discount Program For The Uninsured
723.description: Requires that enrollees in the Rhode Island best RX Prescription drug discount program for the uninsured are not charged a copay for their prescriptions.

724.title: Relating To Corporations, Associations, And Partnerships
724.description: Imposes a fee of one hundred sixty dollars ($160) for all domestic and foreign corporations for a certificate of authority to transact business in this state.

725.title: Rhode Island Public Rail Corporation Act
725.description: Enables the Rhode Island Public Rail Corporation to lower the self-insured retention amount required of the state and would provide indemnification statewide.

726.title: Railroad Preservation
726.description: Suspends payments to the MBTA or its operating subcontractor as long as either is in default of the South County operating agreement.

727.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
727.title: Relating To Taxation-personal Income Tax
727.description: Adds a personal income tax bracket of 8.99% for income over one million dollars ($1,000,000)

728.title: Tax Sales
728.description: Expedites the foreclosure procedure on vacant property.

729.title: Protection Of Information Systems Act
729.description: Requires state, municipal, and quasi-public departments to provide protection of information systems that they own.

730.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
730.title: State Lottery - Disbursement Of Revenue
730.description: Directs profits from the state lottery into an education aid restricted receipt account to be disbursed as state aid to education.

731.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Special Plate For Rhode Island Boy Scouts
731.description: Authorizes a special license plate for Rhode Island Boy Scouts, a nonprofit corporation, and establish the fees and other conditions applicable to its issuance.

733.title: Sales And Use Taxes --liability And Computation
733.description: Exempts the trade-in value of pickup trucks under eight thousand one hundred pounds (8,100 lbs.) gross weight, used exclusively for personal use, from sales tax.

735.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
735.title: Prescription Drug Benefits
735.description: Prohibits any health plan with a pharmacy benefit from requiring the insured to order from a particular pharmacy in order to have payments applied to their deductible.

736.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
736.title: The Rivers And Coastal Adaptation Fund
736.description: Establishes Rhode Island rivers/coastal adaptation fund; enables cities, towns and state to apply for grants to fund projects that invest in measures to address the impacts of climate change. Trust to be funded by fees on barrels of petroleum products.

737.title: Relating To Sports, Racing And Athletics
737.description: Authorizes the division of racing and athletics to implement online games of skill including fantasy sports.

738.title: Emergency Management Director Emeritus
738.description: Creates an emergency management director emeritus license plate for Thomas F. Senerchia of West Warwick.

739.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
739.title: Rhode Island Global Warming Solutions Act
739.description: Establishes the Rhode Island global warming solutions act to reduce carbon emissions across various sectors of the local economy.

740.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Environment and Natural Resources
740.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers-the Energy And Consumer Savings Act Of 2005
740.description: Establishes minimum energy and water efficiency standards for certain products sold or installed in the state.

741.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
741.title: Primary Care Trust Act
741.description: Creates the "Primary Care Trust Act" to require health insures to allocate a fair portion of medical spending for the delivery of primary care services and creates a trust for administration of the program.

742.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation -- Motor Vehicles Lease Payments
742.description: Prohibits the collection of a sales or use tax on that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment representing taxes payable by the lessor on the leased motor vehicle.

744.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
744.title: Sugary Drinks
744.description: Creates a tax on sugary drinks for the purpose of reducing the demand for those beverages, and discouraging the excessive consumption of, sugary drinks.

747.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
747.title: Building On Or Development Of State Land
747.description: Requires general assembly approval for construction on or development of certain classes of state-owned properties.

748.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

752.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

753.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

755.description: Limits recovery of costs for permitting activities during periods of normal building activity multipliers for fees based on value.

761.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

765.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

784.description: Directs council on postsecondary education to assess $50.00 per semester transportation fee on RI public college students with student ID cards serving as pass for services furnished/operated by RI public transit authority.

924.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Little Creek Landscaping And Excavating Llc

937.description: GIS) AND TECHNOLOGY FUND (Requires the department of administration prepare an accounting of the funds used to operate the 911 emergency system.

941.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Blanken Realty Corporation
