980.title: Motor Carriers Of Property
980.description: Allows tow truck operators as of January 1, 2020, to annually raise rates and charges consistent with the increase in the Consumer Price Index to a maximum of eight percent (8%).

981.title: Authorizing The Town Of Smithfield To Issue Not To Exceed $45,000,000 In General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidence Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 40% For Expenditures Eligible For Reimbursement
981.description: Authorizes the town of Smithfield to issue not more than $45,000,000 bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, alteration and repair, furnishing and equipping of schools and school facilities.

982.title: Authorizing The Town Of Smithfield To Issue Not To Exceed $4,500,000 In General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidence Of Indebtedness To Finance The Acquistion, Construction, Building, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Fire Station In The Town
982.description: Authorizes the town of Smithfield to issue not more than $4,500,000 bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the acquisition, construction, building, furnishing and equipping of a new fire station in the town.

984.title: Explosives And Fireworks
984.description: Amends the criminal offense for placing bombs or falsely reporting bomb threats and criminalizes the possession of materials readily convertible to a bomb or explosive device.

985.title: Voluntary Restructuring Of Solvent Insurers
985.description: Allows domestic insurance company to enter into a voluntary restructuring, including the use of a protected cell, with the approval of the commissioner.

986.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tpsp, Llc
986.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tpsp, Llc

987.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
987.title: Mechanical Trades
987.description: Adds thermal systems insulation to the regulation and licensing of mechanical trades.

990.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (05/16/2018)
990.title: Mandatory Educational Community Service
990.description: Requires all students to perform a minimum amount of community service each school year and grants them the option to perform certain forms of community service for academic credit.

991.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
991.title: Meal And Beverage Tax
991.description: Authorizes Newport and Middletown to collect an additional one percent (1%) meal and beverage tax to fund schools, school safety, and capital improvements.

993.description: Makes a number of technical amendments to the general laws, prepared at the recommendation of the Law Revision Office. Article I contains the reenactment of title 7 of the general laws. Article II includes the statutory construction provisions.

994.title: Levy And Assessment Of Local Taxes--city Of Central Falls
994.description: Authorizes Central Falls to adopt 3 separate tax classifications of residential property consisting of tax rates: owner-occupied property of 5 units or less/dwellings of 6 units or more/non owner-occupied property of 5 units or less, including mixed use.

995.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Finance Construction, Renovations, Remediation, Alterations, Additions And Other Improvements And/or Related Equipment And To Issue Not More Than $27,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor, Of Which Up To $13,500,000 Is For School Purposes And Up To $13,500,000 Is For Other Town Purposes
995.description: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Finance Construction, Renovations, Remediation, Alterations, Additions And Other Improvements And/or Related Equipment And To Issue Not More Than $27,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor, Of Which Up To $13,500,000 Is For School Purposes And Up To $13,500,000 Is For Other Town Purposes

996.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
996.title: Rhode Island Parental And Family Medical Leave Act
996.description: Allows employee granted unpaid family/parental leave to substitute any accrued vacation/sick/ other appropriate leave for any part of the unpaid leave.

999.title: Domestic Violence Prevention Act
999.description: Renames the domestic violence prevention fund as the Deborah DeBare domestic violence prevention fund.

1000.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1000.title: Short-term Rentals Act
1000.description: Establishes the "Short-Term Rentals Act" which sets forth requirements for short-term listing services and short-term rental providers when renting to a person for less than thirty (30) days.

1001.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1001.title: Registration Of Voters
1001.description: Changes the period of time a voter may have to change their party affiliation from the 90th day preceding any primary election for which the voter is eligible to the 29th day preceding any primary election for which the voter is eligible.

1006.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1006.title: Student Transportation
1006.description: Includes the towns of Lincoln and North Providence in Region I and the city of Cranston and the town of Johnston in Region II for grades nine (9) through twelve (12) for school bus districts.

1007.title: Authorizing The Town Of Jamestown To Issue General Obligation Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $2,900,000 To Finance New Construction, Demolition, Renovations And/or Improvements To Jamestown Golf Course And Facilities At 245 Conanicus Avenue And Related Equipment
1007.description: Authorizes the Town of Jamestown to issue not more than $2,900,000 bonds and notes to finance various improvements at the town of Jamestown's golf course and facilities and related equipment.

1008.title: Authorizing The Town Of Jamestown To Finance Library Renovations, Repairs And/or Expansion And Related Equipment By The Issuance Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor
1008.description: Authorizes the Town of Jamestown to issue not more than $1,000,000 bonds and notes to finance various improvements at the town of Jamestown's library and related equipment.

1009.title: Authorizing The Town Of Jamestown To Issue General Obligation Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $5,900,000 To Finance Replacements, Renovations And Improvements And Related Equipment At The Jamestown Public Schools
1009.description: Authorizes the town of Jamestown to issue not more than $5,900,000 bonds and notes to finance various improvements and related equipment at the town of Jamestown's schools.

1010.title: Commercial Low Speed Vehicles
1010.description: Authorizes commercial low speed vehicles of 8 persons or less to operate on roadways of the city of Newport as a commercial jitney service.

1011.title: Medicaid Eligible Non-emergency Medical Transportation Act
1011.description: Creates the Medicaid eligible non-emergency medical transportation act.

1013.title: Powers And Duties -- Chemical Dependency Professionals
1013.description: Provides that the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals with the power and duty to certify a list of chemical dependency professionals for use by state agencies and for referral of individuals for treatment.

1014.title: Authorizing The Town Of Cumberland, With The Approval Of The Qualified Electors, To Issue General Obligation Bonds And/or Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $2,500,000 For Street Pavement Improvements In The Town
1014.description: Authorizes the town of Cumberland to issue two million five hundred thousand dollars ($2,500,000) of the general obligation bonds and notes in order to finance street pavement improvements.

1015.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Coderre Drywall, Inc.
1015.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Coderre Drywall, Inc.

1016.title: Workers' Compensation
1016.description: Allows waiver of prior claimed common law rights by corp./LLC officers/Enlarges advisory council from 16 to 17 members/Imposes certain limitations on payments to injured employees/Authorizes uninsured protection fund to promulgate rules and regulations.

1017.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
1017.title: Expedited Permit Process
1017.description: Allows RI municipalities to request an expedited permit review process for certain critical municipal public safety projects. The process would be the same as projects of critical economic concern. It would also waive permit fees for municipalities.

1019.title: Relating To Tax Increment Financing In The Town Of Middletown
1019.description: Permits the Middletown town council to choose the assessment date to be the baseline for its tax increment area.

1022.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Construction, Renovation And Improvement, Repair, Alteration, Furnishing And Equipping Of Public Buildings In The City And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $5,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1022.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $5,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, repair, alteration, furnishing and equipping of public buildings.

1023.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Improvement And Replacement Of Road Safety Improvements And Traffic Control Devices In The City Of Pawtucket And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1023.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the improvement and replacement of road safety improvements.

1024.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Planning, Evaluation, Design, Construction And Reconstruction Of The Sanitary Sewers And Storm Sewers In The City Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,500,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1024.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,500,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the planning, evaluation, design, construction and reconstruction of the sewer and sanitation system.

1025.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Repaving Of Streets In The City And All Costs Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $5,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1025.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $5,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the repaving of streets and all costs related thereto.

1026.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Bridges And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1026.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, reconstruction and repair of bridges and all costs incidental or related thereto.

1027.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Design, Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Streets, Sidewalks And Other Transportation Infrastructure Improvements Including, But Not Limited To, Drainage And Landscaping And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $7,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1027.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $7,000,000 bonds for streets and sidewalks.

1028.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Renovation, Construction, Reconstruction And Equipping Of Public Recreation Facilities In The City Including Land Acquisition And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $4,500,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2020 And 2021
1028.description: Authorizes Pawtucket to issue not more than $4,500,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences renovation, construction, reconstruction and equipping of public recreation facilities of indebtedness to finance and all costs related thereto.

1029.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Issue Not To Exceed $220,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The City, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 75% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
1029.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $220,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness.

1030.title: Abused And Neglected Children -- Duty To Report
1030.description: Requires representatives of educational programs to notify their leadership of all reports of sexual abuse who shall notify the department of children, youth and families and the school superintendent.

1032.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1032.title: Travel Insurance Act
1032.description: Creates the "Travel Insurance Act" to establish a comprehensive and uniform regulatory framework to clarify current applicable law applicable to travel insurance policies.

1034.title: City Of Providence Retail Licenses
1034.description: Authorizes the city of Providence to issue a retail liquor license to a businesses located on Broad Street while prohibiting many other listed purposes.

1037.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1037.title: Health And Safety--alternative Payment Incentive For Certain Eligible Hospitals
1037.description: Establishes a formula to create a transitional alternative payment method incentive to be used in calculating reimbursement rates that must be paid by health insurance carriers to eligible Rhode Island hospitals.

1039.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1039.title: Relating To Towns And Cities-retirement Of Municipal Employees
1039.description: Increases the base pension benefit for surviving spouses of beneficiaries from sixty-seven and one half (67.5%) percent to one hundred percent (100%), retroactive to July 1, 2014.

1040.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1040.title: Hospital Closure Transition Act
1040.description: Creates the "Hospital Closure Transition Act which would facilitate the acquisition of a closed hospital's assets by an existing hospital by exempting the acquisition from the hospital conversions and health care facilities licensing acts.

1042.title: Authorizing The City Of East Providence To Finance The Acquisition, Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New High School And All Expenses Incident Thereto, Including, But Not Limited To, Costs Of Design, Demolition, Athletic Fields, Landscaping And Parking By The Issuance Of Not More Than $189,500,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 50% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
1042.description: Authorizes the city of East Providence to issue not more than $189,500,000 bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the acquisition, construction, furnishing and equipping of a new high school.

1044.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1044.title: School Security Personnel Employment
1044.description: Enables all persons with at least two (2) years law enforcement or military work experience to work as a school security employee regardless of the nature, source or amount of their other income.

1045.title: Minority Business Enterprise
1045.description: Provides that any minority business enterprise that is certified under the Federal Small Business Act shall be deemed certified by the department of administration as a minority business enterprise.

1046.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1046.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies--step Therapy Protocol
1046.description: Requires health insurers, nonprofit hospital service corporations, nonprofit medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations that issue policies that provide coverage for prescription drugs and use step therapy protocols.

1047.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1047.title: Middletown Tax Levy
1047.description: Prohibits the town of Middletown from annually increasing its tax levy, more than 2% of the total levied by the town, for its prior fiscal year, without the occurrence of one or more of 5 conditions and an affirmative vote of the majority of its electors.

1048.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1048.title: Middletown Real Estate Tax Assessment
1048.description: Allows the town of Middletown to adopt annual fair market assessments of its ratable property that do not exceed the two percent (2%) annual increase ceiling.

1050.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1050.title: Business Corporation And Personal Income Tax
1050.description: Limit to 7 yrs the period within which bus. corp tax/personal income tax may be assessed for taxpayers failing to file returns on date return was due to be filed/10 yrs within which collection actions can begin from date balance assessed with 4 exceptions

1061.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1061.title: Sexual Harassment, Education And Training In The Workplace
1061.description: Mandates sexual harassment training for employees and supervisors of employers of fifty (50) or more employees. It would recommend an annual climate survey for employers.

1066.title: Application For Tax Credits, State Funds Or State Contracts
1066.description: Mandates applicants for state contracts in excess of $50K disclose discrimination complaints for prior 5 years.

1067.title: Scheduling
1067.description: Establish a uniform election day for all local and special elections.

1068.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Police Chief Emeritus Gary Malikowski
1068.description: Authorizes a police chief emeritus special license plate for Gary Malikowski, former police chief of West Greenwich.

1072.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
1072.description: Redefines the term "covered services" as used to describe applicable subscriber agreements between a health care entity and a dentist, to exclude waiting period provisions.

1074.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1074.title: Food Donations
1074.description: Provides immunity to persons donating food to food banks.

1075.title: Pertaining To The Town Of Scituate -- Proposed Town Charter
1075.description: Allows the Scituate town council to propose a town charter to the voters at the next general election, subject to ratification by the general assembly.

1078.title: Authorizing The Town Of Cumberland To Issue Not To Exceed $83,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 50% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund
1078.description: Authorizing The Town Of Cumberland To Issue Not To Exceed $83,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The Town, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Or State Share Ratio Of Not Less Than 50% For Expenditures Eligible For State Aid And Provided That The Authorization Shall Be Reduced By Any Grant Received From The School Building Authority Capital Fund

1079.title: Naloxone Access
1079.description: Requires the director of the department of health to develop best practices for co-prescribing opioid antagonists to patients who are prescribed opioid analgesics.

1080.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation
1080.description: Adds urns and shrouds, prayer cards and other items customarily sold or provided by a funeral director to those funeral items which are already exempt from sales and use taxes.

1084.title: Coastal Resources Management Council
1084.description: Amends the composition, size, and requirements of memberships on the Coastal Resources Management Council.

1085.title: Sports Betting
1085.description: Establishes 9 sports betting parlor licenses for on-site/on-line wagering with DBR granted licensing/regulatory power relating to license issuance to applicants/emplolyees/third-party vendors/collection of fees/taxes with local licensing. eff. 11/6/18

1094.title: Equal Opportunity And Affirmative Action
1094.description: Regulates procedures for granting/denial of state licenses/documents required for pursuing profession/business requiring same based on prior conviction of a crime/crimes unless directly related.

1095.title: Veterans' Exemptions
1095.description: Eliminates the requirement that a service person serving in conflicts or undeclared wars receive a campaign ribbon or expeditionary medal in order to receive a property tax exemption.

1097.title: Casualty Insurance Generally
1097.description: Includes coverage for residential property for vandalism and malicious mischief unless the property has been vacant for more than sixty (60) days.

1101.title: Child Products And Upholstered Furniture
1101.description: Increases from one hundred parts per million (100 ppm) to one thousand parts per million (1,000 ppm) the maximum amount of organohalogen flame retardant chemical contained in residential upholstered bedding and furniture, manufactured or sold in the state

1103.title: Relating To The Act Making Appropriations For The Support Of The State For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2019
1103.description: Relating To The Act Making Appropriations For The Support Of The State For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2019

1104.title: Health Care--health Insurance
1104.description: Establishes the Rhode Island reinsurance program that will provide reinsurance to insurance carriers that offer health insurance coverage on the individual market, to mitigate the impact of high-risk individuals on health insurance rates.

1105.title: Abuse And Exploitation Of Elders--abuse And Isolation Of Elders Or Dependent Adults -- The Peter Falk Criminal Isolation Of Elders Act
1105.description: Criminalizes isolation of an elder or dependent adult and would provide that certain notification requirements be fulfilled on behalf of elder persons or dependent adults.

1106.title: Real Estate Sales Disclosures
1106.description: Requires that any use of a premises for marijuana cultivation be disclosed in any real estate transaction.

1108.title: The I-195 Redevlopment Act Of 2011
1108.description: Allows the I-195 Redevelopment commission to make certain alterations to the boundaries of a portion of the I-195 redevelopment called "Parcel P4".

1365.title: Joint Resolution Making An Appropriation Of $150,000 To The Opportunities Industrialization Center Of Rhode Island (authorizes The Appropriation Of The Sum Of $150,000 To The Opportunities Industrialization Center Of Rhode Island.)
1365.description: Joint Resolution Making An Appropriation Of $150,000 To The Opportunities Industrialization Center Of Rhode Island (authorizes The Appropriation Of The Sum Of $150,000 To The Opportunities Industrialization Center Of Rhode Island.)

1366.description: Joint Resolution Making An Appropriation To Pay Certain Claims

1375.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief
1375.description: Amends the Education and Property Tax Relief Act by setting the regionalization bonus at (2%) of the state's share of foundation education formula and by eliminating third year bonus provision.

1378.title: Property Tax Relief
1378.description: Amends the definition of "disabled", for the purposes of property tax relief, to include veterans who earn less than $30,000 annually, and who receive disability benefits from the United States Department of Veterans Affairs.

1394.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs
1394.title: Initiative And Referendum
1394.description: Provides a detailed process by which a proponent of a voter initiative and referendum proposal would present the proposal to the secretary of state, the general assembly and the governor.

1395.title: Joint Committee On Legislative Services
1395.description: Includes the majority leader of the senate as a member of the joint committee on legislative services.

1396.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Joseph Merritt & Company, Incorporated
1396.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Joseph Merritt & Company, Incorporated

1397.title: Relating To Video Lottery Games, Table Games And Sports Wagering
1397.description: Authorizes the implementation and operation of sports wagering at the Twin River and Tiverton gaming facilities.

1401.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1401.title: The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
1401.description: Requires that the board of elementary and secondary education adopt a competency-based/proficiency-based learning policy whereby students can earn credits through demonstration of competency.

1403.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1403.title: Energy Siting
1403.description: Requires carbon-emissions-reduction goals be considered in energy plant siting proceedings.

1405.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1405.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liabilities And Computation
1405.description: Exempts the trade-in values of motorcycles from sales tax.

1410.title: Rhode Island Housing Resources Act Of 1998
1410.description: Requires the general assembly to appropriate a minimum of five million dollars ($5,000,000) in capital financing to Rhode Island Housing & Mortgage Finance Corporation (RIHMFC) for the development of affordable housing for the homeless.

1414.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Enforcement And Collection
1414.description: Enacts a ten (10) year limitations statute on collection actions for any due and payable sales and use estate personal income business corporation tax effective July 1, 2018.

1422.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1422.title: Historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
1422.description: Provides that applicants for historic tax credits shall have ninety (90) days after the date of the commission's written determination certifying the rehabilitation to pay the required three percent (3%) non-refundable fee to the division of taxation.

1426.title: Unanticipated Out-of-network Bills For Health Care Services
1426.description: Protects people with health insurance from surprise medical bills for emergency and other services by requiring a non-participating health care provider to bill an insured party only for a co-payment, or deductible.

1427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1427.title: Developmental Disabilities Ombudsperson Act Of 2018
1427.description: Creates ombudsperson program for developmental disabilities attached to department of administration with ombudsperson selected by committee named by governor to advocate on behalf of affected adults.

1430.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1430.title: The Licensure, Inspections And Investigations Of Developmental Disabilities Facilities
1430.description: Requires Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities and Hospitals to make or cause to be made annual unannounced inspections and investigations of community residences.

1431.title: Relating To Human Services
1431.description: Authorizes HHS to apply for waivers to ensure for housing, healthcare, and mental and behavioral health care services for the homeless.

1432.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1432.title: Water Supply
1432.description: Allows the town of Smithfield to charge interest on delinquent water payments at a rate of not more than twelve percent (12%) per annum.

1440.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1440.title: Corrections Department
1440.description: Prevents the director of the department of corrections from restricting in-person visitation of inmates in the event that the department implemented electronic visitation or contact, such as skype, between inmates and visitors.

1444.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1444.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-assaults
1444.description: Provides that assaults on police officers and other officials be punished by no less than one year but no more than three years' incarceration.

1447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1447.title: Law Practice
1447.description: Requires duly admitted members of the bar of this state to acquire and maintain malpractice insurance in the minimum amount of one million dollars ($1,000,000).

1456.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Modern Condominiums, Inc.
1456.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Modern Condominiums, Inc.

1459.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1459.title: Traffic Safety Education
1459.description: Requires board of education approval of new driver driver education courses with online institutions available for parents/guardians/designees in addition to classroom setting.

1463.title: Student And Residential Mortgage Loans
1463.description: Authorizes the creation of a state sponsored loan program to provide financial assistance to purchase a home and to help pay off student debt.

1469.title: Retirement System - Contribution And Benefits
1469.description: Removes some of the restrictions on post-retirement re-employment of public employees.

1478.title: Department Of Attorney General -- Gun Crimes Report
1478.description: Directs the attorney general to report annually to the general assembly on the incidence and disposition of crimes involving guns.

1495.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1495.title: Relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
1495.description: Adds campus police officers to group of public safety officials eligible to collect salary, wages, and benefits during periods of whole/partial incapacitation incurred while on-duty, or while providing emergency assistance within the state while off-duty.

1499.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1499.title: Post Retirement Income
1499.description: Allows a retired member of the teachers, state employees, or municipal retirement system to serve as an elected town treasurer without a suspension of their retirement benefits.

1501.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1501.title: Police Arbitration
1501.description: Changes the last day for a request for municipal police arbitration agreement to 120 days before the expiration of the current collective bargaining agreement.

1508.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1508.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities -- Costs
1508.description: Requires that all costs incurred by municipal corporations associated with the temporary or permanent relocation public utility poles during public works projects within municipal rights-of-way be borne by the public utility.

1518.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1518.title: Career And Technical Education
1518.description: Provides that the department of education, in consultation with a workgroup composed of various stakeholders, develop a funding formula for school districts sending students to career and technical programs outside the district

1521.title: School Committees And Superintendents -- Beginning Of School Year
1521.description: Requires public schools, including charter schools, begin the school year on the day after Labor Day commencing in the school year 2019-2020.

1523.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1523.title: Freshwater Fishing
1523.description: Permits trout fishing in waters at any time of year without seasonal restriction.

1524.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1524.title: Taxation Of Beverage Containers, Hard-to-dispose Material And Litter Control Participation Permittee
1524.description: Eliminates the tax imposed on hard-to-dispose materials such as lubricating oils, glycol-based antifreeze and tires used on motor vehicles.

1526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1526.title: Start-up Rhode Island Tax Free Zone Program
1526.description: Establishes the "Start-Up Rhode Island Act" to allow for the establishment of certain tax free zones in the state.

1528.title: Stay Invested In Ri Wavemaker Fellowship
1528.description: Repeals the provisions of the Stay Invested in RI Wavemaker Fellowship, and establish the Stay Invested in RI Tax Credit to provide eligible taxpayers with a tax credit for educational loan repayment expenses.

1537.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1537.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Personal Income Tax
1537.description: Subtracts state tax refunds, paid to an individual in the previous year, from federal adjusted gross income, for purposes of the state income tax for tax years beginning January 1, 2019.

1538.title: Relating To Taxation-property Subject To Taxation
1538.description: Authorizes cities and towns to tax certain real and/or nonprofit tangible properties owned by nonprofit educational and hospital institutions commencing with assessment performed 12/31/18 and every year thereafter.

1541.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1541.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Compensation
1541.description: Exempts the trade-in value of pickup trucks weighing fourteen thousand pounds (14,000 lbs.) or less from sales and use tax.

1542.title: Insurance Benefits
1542.description: Entitles correctional officers with twenty-five (25) years of service and who are at least fifty-five (55) years of age to a non-Medicare-eligible retiree health care insurance benefit.

1547.title: Rhode Island New Qualified Jobs Incentive Act 2015
1547.description: Changes the sunset provision of the Rhode Island New Qualified Jobs Incentive Act 2015 from December 31, 2018 to January 1, 2018.

1554.title: Rhode Island Infrastructure Bank
1554.description: Provides school housing aid for certain projects approved by the state including funding for payment of interest on certain bonds and leases.

1555.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1555.title: Nonprofit Dental Service Corporations
1555.description: Requires written notice to certain plan purchasers of rule changes.

1559.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities - Influenza Immunization
1559.description: Requires hospitals to offer immunization against influenza virus to all inpatients sixty-five (65) years of age or older from October to March of the following year.

1560.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1560.title: Licensing Of Health-care Facilities
1560.description: Establishes limits on the maximum number of patients that may be assigned to a unit’s registered nurses in particular health care situations.

1574.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1574.title: Zoning
1574.description: Authorizes the town of Foster to enact an ordinance banning gravel operations from agricultural, forest management, or residential areas.

1578.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1578.title: Holiday And Sunday Work
1578.description: For purposes of overtime on Sundays and holidays, remove the exemption in the definition of employees for health care and maintenance workers, thereby entitling them to overtime pay.

1580.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1580.title: Minimum Wage
1580.description: Increases the minimum wages to eleven dollars ($11.00) per hour, commencing January 1, 2019, and to twelve dollars ($12.00) per hour, commencing January 1, 2020.

1585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1585.title: Retail Licenses - Training
1585.description: Requires the department of business regulation to administer testing to certify alcohol server training. It would also prohibit online testing.

1595.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1595.title: Wrongful Discharge From Employment
1595.description: Ends Rhode Island's "employment-at-will" legal doctrine, provides job protection for employees that satisfactorily perform their duties provides specific remedies for wrongful discharge.

1596.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1596.title: Unclaimed Intangible And Tangible Property
1596.description: Authorizes police departments/local drug control divisions to keep confiscated property with any derived income available for community/law enforcement purposes.

1597.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1597.title: State Affairs And Government - Residence Of Those In Government Custody Act
1597.description: Requires the state to use the actual residence of persons in government custody for redistricting purposes.

1612.title: Administrative Procedures Act
1612.description: Provides that when an agency publicly proposes for notice and comment or otherwise promulgates a new rule or regulation, it would identify at least one existing rule or regulation to be repealed.

1619.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1619.title: Immigration Status
1619.description: Prohibits a landlord from asking about the immigration status of a tenant, prospective tenant, occupant, or prospective occupant of residential rental property.

1638.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Broadway Gas, Llc
1638.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Broadway Gas, Llc

1642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1642.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Interest And Usury
1642.description: Reduces the usury rate to twelve percent (12%).

1653.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1653.title: Relating To Financial Institutions
1653.description: Allows small loan lenders to charge borrowers fees pursuant to applicable federal and state laws provided, they are disclosed and agreed to in writing.

1654.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1654.title: Low-income Energy Cost Assistance
1654.description: Creates an energy assistance program within the governor's energy assistance office with incentives for regular payments and conservation.

1662.title: State Department Of Elementary And Secondary Education
1662.description: Authorizes the council on elementary and secondary education to waive certain provisions of the laws for public schools but would prohibit the waiver of other listed provisions.

1666.title: Out Of School Time Learning Commission
1666.description: Creates a permanent joint commission to improve and increase the number of quality out of school time learning programs in the state.

1673.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1673.title: The Climate Change Coastal Adaptation Trust Fund
1673.description: Establishes the RI coastal adaptation trust fund. The trust would enable cities and towns and the state to apply for grants to fund projects that invest in measures that adapt infrastructure on public lands to address the impacts of climate change.

1684.title: Retirement System -- Contributions And Benefits
1684.description: Addresses the age-related disparate treatment of state employees who were eligible to retire by reason of age on June 30, 2012. The act exempts these employees from the 401(a) plan, and returns them to the traditional defined benefit plan.

1688.title: Council On Postsecondary Education
1688.description: Authorizes and direct the board of governors for higher education to assess a transportation fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) per semester to students attending a RI public institution of higher learning.

1700.title: Renewable Energy Tax Credit
1700.description: Provides for a residential renewable energy systems tax credit.

1713.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance
1713.description: Allows pregnant women with an annual family income above applicable Medicaid income limit to be eligible to purchase health insurance through one of the Medicaid managed care plans.

1730.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1730.title: Courts - Commission On Judicial Tenure And Discipline
1730.description: Amends several provisions relative to how the commission on judicial tenure and discipline provide discipline, hearings and discovery.

1747.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1747.title: The Hospitals Conversions Act
1747.description: Requires hospitals closing ER dept/primary care services to pay expenses for special master/financial consultant/submit written plan dealing with employees/establish ad hoc community leader group/offset closure effect on municipality for 5 years.

1761.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1761.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes - Portability Of Credit
1761.description: Establishes portability of the estate tax credit and allow a deceased spousal unused credit against the Rhode Island estate tax of a surviving spouse for the unused estate tax credit of the first spouse to die.

1769.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1769.title: Snow Removal Service Liability Limitation Act
1769.description: Regulates snow removal contracts between service providers and service receivers, limit liability between them, and declare certain indemnity agreements void as against public policy.

1772.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles-motor Vehicles Reparations Act
1772.description: Penalizes a motorist for two (2) separate violations if they are driving an unregistered motor vehicle and without insurance or proof of insurance.

1773.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1773.title: Tobacco And Nicotine Products -- Children
1773.description: Provides certain restrictions on the sale of tobacco products, enhances the definition of "tobacco products", and raises the legal minimum age to purchase tobacco products and nicotine-delivery systems from 18 to 21 years of age.

1781.title: Jobs Development Act
1781.description: Sunset/discontinue the Jobs Development Act rate reduction as of July 1, 2018.

1800.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1800.title: Life Insurance Policies And Reserves
1800.description: Requires an insurer of life insurance to provide annual notice to the insured and provides instructions and necessary forms to change the beneficiary.

1802.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1802.title: Underground Utility Excavation
1802.description: Requires public utilities or its contractors to reimburse excavators for lost time expense incurred as a result of incorrect markings.

1805.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1805.title: Utility District Energy Costs
1805.description: Requires the state to pay the energy costs necessary to supply public street lighting if the local utility district fails to do so.

1816.title: Appropriation To The Professional Development Investment Fund
1816.description: Authorizes the appropriation of ten million dollars ($10,000,000) to the professional development investment fund for fiscal year 2019.

1823.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1823.title: Long-term Economic Development
1823.description: Requires a long-term economic policy/strategic implementation plan to receive a public hearing by house/senate, but also a vote of approval with transmittal to the governor for signature before it takes effect.

1825.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1825.title: State Tax Officials
1825.description: Places twelve percent (12%) per annum interest rate on delinquent tax payments for business corporation, sales and use, estate and personal income taxes.

1832.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A
1832.title: Prescription Drug Benefits--prescription Drug Marketing
1832.description: Regulates prescription drug marketing by manufacturers using strategies offering various discounts to disguise costs of high priced drugs versus lower costs alternatives and makes discounts available to individuals without health insurance. Eff. 1/1/19.

1838.title: Registration Of Nursing Assistants
1838.description: Allows for a nurse to delegate tasks to certified nursing assistants and authorizes the department of health to promulgate regulations that delineate delegable tasks.

1846.title: Comprehensive Discharge Planning
1846.description: Requires the directors of BHDDH to develop and implement a program to offer financial incentives to hospitals and emergency facilities that achieve Level 1 certification in level of care.

1850.title: Medical Assistance -- Long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
1850.description: Establishes a public scorecard system to show how long-term care reform is meeting its goals of rebalancing the way services are delivered and moneys are spent on various service types.

1852.title: Rhode Island Livable Home Modification Act
1852.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Livable Home Modification Grant allowing individuals to retrofit their residence to nationally recognized accessibility standards and receive fifty percent (50%) of the total sum spent, up to five thousand dollars ($5,000).

1853.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1853.title: Sidewalks Along State Highways
1853.description: Requires the department of transportation to clear sidewalks of snow and ice on state roads for school bus stops along routes approved by the respective school committees and chief of police for each city and town.

1856.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1856.title: Kent County Water District
1856.description: Reduces the term of office members and chair of the Kent County Water District board from seven (7) years to three (3) years, effective September 1, 2018 and limits the chair to three (3) consecutive terms.

1867.title: Electronic Voting
1867.description: Requires the joint committee on legislative services to make the record of the votes of the general assembly available to the public and the secretary of state electronically within thirty (30) minutes of the casting of said vote.

1869.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1869.title: Declarations Of Candidacy
1869.description: Changes the month in which candidates for public office are required to declare their candidacy from June to April.

1871.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1871.title: Party Primary Date
1871.description: Changes the date of party primaries from the second Tuesday after the first Monday in September in each even numbered year to the first Tuesday in June in each even numbered year.

1872.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1872.title: School Buses--ignition Interlock Systems
1872.description: Requires all school buses to be equipped with ignition interlock systems.

1873.title: Marijuana Impact Study
1873.description: Creates and funds a study on the impact of the use of marijuana in this state.

1875.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1875.title: Rhode Island Legislative Employee Whistle Blower Protection Act
1875.description: Creates legislative employee whistleblower protection to report criminal and ethics violations.

1877.title: Public Assistance Act -- Drug Testing
1877.description: Authorizes random drug screening as a condition for continued public assistance, and would provide a mechanism for retesting those who fail the test.

1879.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1879.title: Department Of Children, Youth And Families
1879.description: Creates process within DCYF for reviewing a determination that out-of-home residential placement is appropriate in an effort to ensure that a child is placed in the least restrictive placement. Requires DCYF to develop plan for recruiting foster families.

1881.title: Internet Digital Blocking
1881.description: Requires Internet service providers to provide digital blocking of sexual content and patently offensive material. It would allow consumers to deactivate digital block upon payment of a twenty dollar ($20.00) fee.

1882.title: Abortion -- The Rhode Island Unborn Child Protection From Dismemberment Abortion Act
1882.description: Defines and would regulate, and in some cases, would prohibit dismemberment abortions.

1887.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1887.title: Sentence And Execution
1887.description: Removes the requirement that the attorney general consent to a deferment of sentencing in a written deferral agreement and grant the superior court traditional discretion in sentencing matters.

1900.title: Fiscal Notes
1900.description: Establishes special requirements for fiscal impact statements relative to the department of corrections.

1904.title: Registration And Licensing Board
1904.description: Distinguishes the criminal penalties for violating a final order of the Contractors' Registration Board. Judgments less than $5,000 are misdemeanors; judgments $5,000 or more are felonies.

1910.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1910.title: Real Estate Conveyance
1910.description: Exempts from the real estate conveyance tax certain low-income and affordable housing developments.

1920.title: Equal Pay Data Collection And Reporting
1920.description: Requires an employer of 100 or more employees to report information as to compensation/hours worked by age/gender/race/ethnicity/job category/occupation/title to DLT eff. 1/1/19.

1925.title: Council On Elementary And Secondary Education [see Title 16 Chapter 97 - The Rhode Island Board Of Education]
1925.description: Commissioner of elementary and secondary education would be appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the senate and serves at the pleasure of the governor.

1929.title: The Green Buildings Act
1929.description: Requires major public facility projects meet green globe and ANSI standards.

1937.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1937.title: State Aid -- Town Of Exeter
1937.description: Clarifies the status of pilot payments to the town of Exeter in view of its not presently having a police department

1942.title: The Education Equity And Property Relief Act
1942.description: Removes the language which provides for the reduction and elimination of the foundation education aid bonus that is given to regionalized school districts and would be phased out over a two (2) year period.

1945.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1945.title: Personal Income Tax Credit
1945.description: Establishes a new personal income tax credit for individuals who incur expenses caring for a relative that requires assistance with one or more daily living activities as certified by a license physician.

1954.title: Motor Vehicle Body Replacement Parts
1954.description: Provides that insurance companies may not mandate the use of aftermarket parts without the owner's consent on motor vehicles less than 48 months beyond manufacture date.

1960.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1960.title: Procedure Generally -- Nondisclosure Agreements
1960.description: Voids any provision of a settlement that prohibits disclosure of the factual information related to a claim of sexual harassment, retaliation for reporting sexual harassment, and stalking as against public policy.

1963.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1963.title: Indictments, Informations And Complaints
1963.description: Amends the statute of limitations and penalty sections for violations of the campaign contributions and expenditures reporting requirements.

1971.title: Fair Employment Practices--sexual Harassment
1971.description: Extends protection to domestic servants/includes retaliation as unlawful practice and requires employers of 4 or more employees to conduct sexual harassment programs for new employees within 1 month of the date of hire/all employees by September 1, 2018.

1973.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1973.title: Mail Ballots - Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
1973.description: Requires any person voting by mail ballot or emergency mail ballot to provide proof of identity, excepting those in a hospital, hospice, or skilled nursing facility.

1974.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
1974.title: Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses And Misappropriations
1974.description: Requires penalty and restitution payments for larceny and campaign violations by a candidate to be made to the general fund when the victim of the larceny is the candidate's campaign account.

1976.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1976.title: Nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates; Rhode Island Campaign Contributions And Expenditures Reporting; Criminal Offenses -- Theft, Embezzlement, False Pretenses, And Misappropriations
1976.description: Amends certain campaign contribution and expenditure reporting requirements and would provide for forfeiture of campaign contributions upon a conviction or plea of nolo contendere to specified felony crimes relating to public office.

1977.title: Relating To Labor And Labor Relations
1977.description: Requires most employers in Rhode Island to participate in the E/Verify employment authorization program and establishes deadlines to do so.

1978.title: Partial- Birth Abortion
1978.description: Amends and revises the definitions and penalties pertaining to partial-birth abortions. Further provides that any physician who knowingly performs a partial-birth abortion would be guilty of a felony and may be liable for civil penalties and fines.

2005.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2005.title: Minimum Wages For Fire Districts
2005.description: Exempts volunteer firefighters providing services as volunteer firefighters for nonprofit fire districts from the minimum wage requirements.

2009.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Eastland Builders, Inc.
2009.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Eastland Builders, Inc.

2014.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2014.title: The Breast Cancer Act
2014.description: Amends the current law so that digital breast tomosynthesis (dbt) screenings are available wherever mammograms are conducted and to provide insurance coverage for such screenings.

2031.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2031.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles –- Miscellaneous Rules
2031.description: Requires all new school buses purchased or leased on or after January 1, 2020, for use in the state to be equipped with a combination pelvic and upper torso 3-point passenger seat belt system for the operator and each passenger seat.

2032.title: Relating To Education-curriculum
2032.description: Requires elementary schools to provide instruction in cursive penmanship.

2035.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
2035.title: Green Building Standards
2035.description: Exempts school construction projects from green energy requirements.

2038.title: Public Safety Employees
2038.description: Adds department of corrections' correctional officers to the list of public safety employees that are entitled to their full salary if they are injured and become disabled as a result of performance of their job duties.

2039.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2039.title: Uniform Control Substance Act
2039.description: Provides for physician/patient discussion regarding addiction and alternate treatment prior to initial and third opioid prescription.

2040.title: Individual Health Insurance Coverage
2040.description: Authorizes state to seek waiver of ACA to allow qualified small business owners/sole properties to purchase small group health insurance on cost/impact assessment by OHIC provide coverage for essential health benefit categories/services.

2042.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2042.title: Health Care Insurers - Coordination Of Benefits
2042.description: Authorizes the department of business regulation to determine the status of insurers for coordination of benefits purposes when there are two or more insurers.

2043.title: Property Subject To Taxation--town Of Charlestown
2043.description: Authorizes the town of Charlestown, by ordinance, to offer tax dollar credit reductions in lieu of various tax exemptions.

2055.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2055.title: Narragansett Bay Commission
2055.description: Authorizes the Narragansett Bay Commission to enter into agreements with various entities for the acquisition, merger or consolidation of water treatment facilities.

2059.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2059.title: Salaries And Traveling Expenses
2059.description: Requires all non-supervisory classified employees to electronically record their daily work hours.

2066.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2066.title: Quasi-public Corporations Accountability And Transparency Act
2066.description: Mandates that quasi-public corporations limit the use of all funds/property to perform the function/service for which the quasi-public corporation was created. Prohibits the transfer or reallocations of funds held by a quasi-public corporation.

2085.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tuckertown Fire Department, Inc.
2085.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Tuckertown Fire Department, Inc.

2089.title: Relating To School Construction And Education
2089.description: Temporarily expands incentives to enhance the school housing aid ratio to encourage new school and renovation projects.

2093.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies - Step Therapy Protocol
2093.description: Requires health insurers, nonprofit hospital service corporations, nonprofit medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations that issue policies that provide coverage for prescription drugs and use step therapy protocols.

2116.description: Allows the town of Middletown to adopt annual fair market assessments of its ratable property that do not exceed the two percent (2%) annual increase ceiling.

2120.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Barn Yard Enterprises, Inc.
